short_description: fastpath function used to determine if a column follows Normal Distribution using standard normal quantiles.
long_description: fastpath function used to determine if a column follows Normal Distribution using standard normal quantiles.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains input data along with rank columns containing ranks for values in TargetColumn.
input_tables.description: The relation that contains input data along with rank columns containing ranks for values in TargetColumn.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table columns for which standard normal quantiles needs to be generated.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table columns for which standard normal quantiles needs to be generated.

argument_clauses.name: RankColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table columns containing rank values for TargetColumns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table columns containing rank values for TargetColumns.

argument_clauses.name: OutputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names to give to the output columns which will contain standard normal quantiles. By default, the output column names will be generated as TargetColumnName_theoretical_quantiles.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names to give to the output columns which will contain standard normal quantiles. By default, the output column names will be generated as TargetColumnName_theoretical_quantiles.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input table columns to copy to the output table. By default, the function copies no input table columns to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input table columns to copy to the output table. By default, the function copies no input table columns to the output table.
